subject: RE: [junit] Problems testing an InputStream

Chad,

  You need to ensure that your ant script is copying your resource
 =
 files (ie your test .xml data) into whatever directory you're 
  outputtin=
g your .class file to..

  something along the lines of...

  <target name=
=3D"test.install" depends=3D"test.compile">      
     <!-- Copy/install te=
st files -->  
     <copy todir=3D"${test.clz}">
        <fileset dir=3D"${=
test.src}"
                 includes=3D"**/*.xml,**/*.xsl, **/*.xsd **/*.wa=
r **/test-log"
        />
     </copy>     
  </target>

Jem...

ginal Message-----

: Sunday, January 25, 2004 2:09 AM

Subject: [juni=
t] Problems testing an InputStream


Hello,

I am writing a test related to=
 XML parsing.  In the setUp() of my test, I read 
an InputStream as follows=
:

   inputStream =3D this.getClass().getResourceAsStream("sample.xml");

.=
..where sample.xml is in the same directory as my TestCase.

I then have a =
"sanity" check test to make sure I read the InputStream correctly:

   publ=
ic void testSampleInputStreamIsValid() {
     assertNotNull("InputStream sh=
ould not be null", inputStream);
   }

When I run this from within my IDE (=
Eclipse), it works fine - whether I run the 
test directly, or from a suite=
 (which is in another package).

HOWEVER, whenever I run it from Ant or Mav=
en, I get a failure (InputStream is null).

This is probably a basic questi=
on related to reading InputStreams, but I'm not 
sure what is wrong.  Hopef=
ully someone can help, or refer me to some helpful 
documentation.

Thanks,=

Chad
